title: Questions about Tahm Kench's abilities
body:
Why would you level Q before W when W can be used to eat your friends, enemies, and enemy minions, and spit them out doing a similar effect as Q but with AoE. W will be your damaging ability by shooting minions, and after a possibly weak Q and two hits use W so you can eat a enemy. I'm saying this because I see many guides saying to level Q first.

 Also, with his R, when and where would you use it? It seems very situational, maybe to get to lane faster or help another lane, but that's all I use it for.

Please answer my question about my ultimate and why it might be best to level Q first.

replies.body:
Im not a Tahm player, but he is one of the main supports my friend uses when he supports my Kalista. He maxes Q first too.

My guess would be that Q is your most reliable poke, and it scales quite heavily when you level it up. It also has a much shorter cooldown than the W, so even though your W is more useful, and does a lot of damage when you eat someone, you probably get more damage overall damage by maxing Q (as you'll be hitting the enemy more often with Q than W. Even if you're spitting minions, you are still going to hit Q more times then W.) Q also costs less mana, so you want to use it more than W, and theres no point maxing an ability that you don't use as much.

With his R, my friend uses it when we both go back, we let the enemy push up to our tower, and then he ults both me and him behind them.
But if we are in a losing lane, and we both need to buy, but we cant leave lane, we will go B and then he will ult us back to our tower (so its like a free shop basically)

In the late game, my friend uses R to get people (Usually me) into fights.
For example, ill be farming bot, and he will be with me at all times (as is customary with Kalista), then if it looks like the team is about to fight he will ult me straight into position in the fight. This makes for good split pushing, like TF and Shen.
Its also good during an ACE, he will ult right into their base and he will tank the tower while I take it down. (this means we dont waste time, pushing minions up)

i hope all that helps :)

But I find it's more fun to max W first because you can easily eat your ally when he/she takes damage since you're a tank, if a enemy comes close Q then W them, and spit minions for poke. Maybe max Q and W together would be best?

You would level it for the poke, harass and CC.

Being able to slow someone/stun them after 3 auto attacks each use from a distance> Being able to eat them in 3 auto attacks in melee range
Where are you playing Tahm Kench?

Lord basically covered everything, but another factor is that if you're too busy swallowing minions and spitting them at enemies, when they jump in (or Jungler ganks after) you won't be able to swallow your ADC because it will be on cooldown. Also wasting a lot of mana early on.

I used to level up W all the time because the damage was so good, but Q is really useful.

When it comes down to tam ketch's abilities, he makes a great support when positioned well to land abilities.

Im just gonna break down a few points about why its more often Q is levelled up first than W.

Tam-kench's q has a shorter CD than compared to his W. His Q is used to harass or help stun an enemy to secure the kill for your adc or yourself (if your playing top/jg).  Im not too sure but his Q has less mana expense than W.

(just talking in the sense of support role, since I play him in support)

His W, the very important and threat in his kit, it can help saved allies or catch your foes. However the cons are that it has a very long CD in the waning phases unless you get CD items otherwise it has a very long CD. Because his W CD is very long, it must be used carefully, using it prematurely will either get your ally killed when the enemy ganks or missed out on a opportunity kill.

(As a support I tend to not use my W as often, as I would use it to save my ADC)

Also because you want to trade your enemy either by equal or out-trade your enemy, you would level your q, as melee the laner (say a ADC) could kite you down. Its a good ability to poke while staying at a safe distance.

As always try to out-trade your enemy rather them out-trading you.

For his ult, when and where would you use it?

Depending on the situation during either mid/late game, you can either use it to get away unless they have some sort of CC to stop your ult, to flank the enemy, I wouldn't use my ult to get to lane faster since first point into his ult is very very short. 

Maybe use it on lanes who have potential wins over a lane if the laner is in a stalemate.

(I also don't use his ult as often when it comes to first - second skill point put into his ult)
Ty! Do you think it might be good to level Q and W together? Like one point to Q, then W, then Q, then W, and so on?

If you tend to be a little aggressive then Q first and W. IF you want to be aggro and passive then Q and E.

I think that it is best to put points into skills that you would be using more often like Q and E or Q+W.  

Then again, you would want to max out an ability first, prob max out Q -1st then W as tahm kench E scales off the missing health which can be used as a shield or recover some health.

IF your playing aggro then Q+W, Passive Q+E.

Playing against a high-burst ADC then Q+E is the way to go, they chop down a chunk of your health, you can choose to recover some health or get a shield and go in. 

Always level Q up since it is tam-kench's main source of damage, coming second is his W.
Chobi even as support? Because W is his only support ability.

Yeah but tahm-kench Q hurts a lot when their adc exchange MR for ATKSPEED glyph runes so tahm's Q will hurt a lot, but then it comes down to positioning to be able land your Q's (consider the mana expense, if you think you can't land your Q because for reasons such as you might miss, or they're mobile, they being too passive or you will get outraged) then don't, just save your mana for other opportunities. 

I would level up Q, but higher elo may say like level W or such. The only reason I would is 1) I can be at a safe distance, 2) if their adc doesn't take MR runes then it will hurt a lot , 3) Tahm'kench lack of attack speed I would make it up by levelling the damage output from his Q (which is also why I get nosher's tooth regardless what position I am, as I would like to become a threat even as a support).


Oh and I found my mistake, agro is Q+E, passive is Q+W.
